meanings.sent1: She made several gaffes at the party, like spilling her drink on the host.
meanings.sent2: His gaffes during the presentation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The gaffes she made while dancing were quite funny.
meanings.sent4: His constant gaffes turned the meeting into a comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The gaffes he made that night were unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: He gaffes often when he's nervous.
meanings.sent2: She gaffes every time she tries to cook.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks, he gaffes frequently.
meanings.sent4: She gaffes her way through new challenges.
meanings.sent5: He gaffes his way through the obstacle course.

meanings.definition: An embarrassing error in speech or action.
meanings.sent1: Her gaffes in the interview cost her the job.
meanings.sent2: The politician's gaffes were all over the news.
meanings.sent3: His gaffes during the play had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's gaffes added humor to his routine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's gaffes made the students giggle.
